basics.name: Jamela Anderson
basics.label: Registered Nurse (BSN)
basics.summary: Richard hails from Tulsa. He has earned degrees from the University of Oklahoma and Stanford. (Go Sooners and Cardinals!) Before starting Pied Piper, he worked for Hooli as a part time software developer. While his work focuses on applied information theory, mostly optimizing lossless compression schema of both the length-limited and adaptive variants, his non-work interests range widely, everything from quantum computing to chaos theory. He could tell you about it, but THAT would NOT be a “length-limited” conversation!

work.summary: Provided healthcare on telemetry, acute rehab, oncology, and medical surgical floors.
highlights: Adapted quickly to new environments and short orientations
Involved patient, family, and treatment team in plan of care
Managed the unit as a fill in charge nurse
Educated patients on steps to manage pain and post-treatment home care
Performed dressing changes and removal of drains
Taught patients how to improve their mobility and promote healing
Monitored telemetry patients and read strips
Embodied the hospitals mission to care, deliver, innovate, serve
Collaborated with a multidisciplinary team to provide the patient with quality care and ensure patient satisfaction
Educated patients and family on medical condition, medications, and interventions to prevent future hospitalizations
Assess the patient’s physical, psychological, and social needs.
Set goals for the patient and planned nursing interventions to ensure the patient met set goals
Communicated with special needs students about testing accommodations
Counseled students with special needs about receiving disability services
Proctored exams and performed secretarial duties

volunteer.summary: Global movement of free coding clubs for young people.

publications.name: Video compression for 3d media
publications.summary: Innovative middle-out compression algorithm that changes the way we store data.

references.name: Emily Pearson
references.reference: Charge Nurse at St. Joseph Health, (314)703-4471
